c74object.name: cui.log.timeGenerator
c74object.description: Use cui.log.timeGenerator to timestamp log messages.

method.name: asyncread
method.digest: Read a movie from a disk file asynchronously
method.description: Asynchronously reads a movie from a disk file in a non-blocking background thread. If no argument is present a file selection dialog will be presented to choose a file.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Close the currently loaded movie and free any memory associated with it

method.name: cancelframedump
method.description: Stops the frame dump process. See framedump.

method.name: frame
method.digest: Jump to a frame number (fast method)
method.description: Jump to a frame number (fast method).

method.name: frame_true
method.digest: Jump to a frame number (slower, more accurate method)
method.description: Jump to a frame number (slower, more accurate method).

method.name: framedump
method.description:
Commences a framedump, in which the movie will start from a frame specified by start-frame (the default is 1) and automatically output frames in sequence (no bang or outputmatrix message is necessary) up to the frame specified by end-frame, skipping frame-skip frames between each frame. The default values are 1 for the start frame, and the total framecount of the movie for the end frame. The default frame-skip value is 1.
During operation, the message framedump current_frame is sent out the right outlet after each frame has been output. When finished, the message framedump done is output.

method.name: jump
method.digest: Jump to a relative movie frame (fast method)
method.description: Jump to a relative movie frame (fast method).

method.name: jump_true
method.digest: Jump to a relative movie frame (slower, more accurate method)
method.description: Jump to a relative movie frame (slower, more accurate method).

method.name: loadram
method.digest: Load the current movie file into memory
method.description:
loadram will attempt to load the current movie file into memory. The loading happens in a non-blocking background thread. When complete a loadram notification specifying the exact range loaded is sent out the dump outlet.
Arguments allow for specifying a range to load, in seconds. A single positive argument specifies end time, A single negative argument specifies start time from the end, and two arguments specify start and end times.
The cache_size attribute must be set prior to the loadram request to a value large enough to hold frames from the specified range.
When a loadram request is executing the file cannot play back frames until the request is completed or the cancelloadram message is received.

method.name: start
method.description: Starts movie playback at the current rate from the current time value.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops movie playback. rate is unaffected).

method.name: read
method.digest: Read a movie from a disk file/URL
method.description:
Reads a movie from a disk file or URL. If no argument is present a file selection dialog will be presented to choose a file. If the argument is parseable as a URL, the object will attempt to load a movie from that location. Otherwise, an argument is assumed to be a local file name.
If autostart is enabled, the movie will begin playing at once.

method.name: unloadram
method.digest: Release any frames loaded with the loadram message

attribute.name: adapt
attribute.digest: Adapt output matrix dimensions to movie size flag

attribute.name: automatic
attribute.description: Enable automatic matrix output when bound to jit.world.

attribute.name: autostart
attribute.description: Autoplay on movie open flag (default = 1)

attribute.name: cache_size
attribute.digest: The maximum cache size in gigabytes
attribute.description:
The maximum cache size in gigabytes (default = 0.1). The cache stores frames in memory as they are decoded, allowing for efficient playback. When the cache_size limit is reached, the least recently used frames are discarded from the cache.
Reverse playback stutters may be the result of insufficient cache_size.
Care should be taken when adjusting the cache_size, if the frame cache exceeds the available memory, the application may crash.
See the loadram message for loading a file into cache automatically.

attribute.name: colormode
attribute.description: The output matrix's color encoding.

attribute.name: drawto
attribute.description: A render context name, used when output_texture is enabled.

attribute.name: dstrect
attribute.digest: The portion of the output matrix written to by the input frame
attribute.description:
The portion of the output matrix used for decompressing media to the internal matrix (default = 0 0 (matrix width) (matrix height))
The bounds of the rectangle are expressed in the form left top right bottom. All values are relative to the top-left corner of the viewing area of the output matrix.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: The duration of the movie.

attribute.name: engine
attribute.description: Video engine backend. This argument can only be set in the max box. If not specified, it is determined by the Video Engine Max preference. As of this writing, possible values include avf (Mac only), qt and viddll.

attribute.name: framecount
attribute.digest: Number of frames in the movie

attribute.name: framereport
attribute.description: Frame reporting flag (default = 0). When enabled, the message framecalc will be sent from the rightmost outlet of the jit.movie object as each frame is processed, followed by the number of milliseconds spent doing so.

attribute.name: loop
attribute.description: Looping mode (default = 1 (start to end))

enum.name: palindrome
enum.digest: 2 = palindrome looping (start to end to start to ....)

enum.name: playback-limits
enum.digest: 3 = no looping, but use looppoints to define playback limits

attribute.name: loopend
attribute.description: The movie loop point end. Time is specified as time values.

attribute.name: looppoints
attribute.description: The movie loop points. Time is specified as time values.

attribute.name: loopreport
attribute.description: Loop notification flag (default = 0). When enabled, the jit.movie object will send the message loopnotify when the playing movie passes the loop point. In palindrome looping mode, the message will be sent at both the beginning and the end of the movie.

attribute.name: loopstart
attribute.description: The movie loop point start. Time is specified as time values.

attribute.name: moviefile
attribute.digest: Load a movie file from disk
attribute.description: Load a movie file from disk

attribute.name: moviename
attribute.description: Identifies the file name of a movie (Note: setting this attribute does not load a movie file).

attribute.name: moviepath
attribute.digest: Fully specified path on disk for the movie
attribute.description: The movie's fully-specified path on disk, if the movie has a disk-file (Note: setting this attribute does not load a movie file).

attribute.name: output_texture
attribute.description:
Enable OpenGL texture output (default = 0). When enabled an OpenGL texture is output instead of a Jitter matrix. The object's drawto attribute must be set to a valid gl context. An RGBA texture is output using the movie's native dimensions. When enabled, the following attributes have no effect:
adapt
colormode
dim
dstrect
srcrect
usedstrect
usesrcrect

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Current playback position, normalized between 0. and 1.

attribute.name: seconds
attribute.description: The movie duration in seconds.

attribute.name: srcrect
attribute.digest: The portion of the input matrix used when copying an input matrix to the internal matrix
attribute.description: The portion of the movie to decompress into a matrix (default = 0 0 (movie width) (movie height)). The bounds of the rectangle are expressed in the form left top right bottom. All values are relative to the top-left corner of the viewing area of the movie.

attribute.name: texture_name
attribute.description: Output texture name, when output_texture is enabled.

attribute.name: time
attribute.description: The current time in the movie. The actual time in seconds depends on the timescale attribute.

attribute.name: time_secs
attribute.description: Current playback time in seconds. See the above Discussion for information on using seeknotify when setting this attribute.

attribute.name: timescale
attribute.description: The timescale for the movie (default = 600, but movie-dependent). The timescale determines the number of time units per second.

attribute.name: unique
attribute.description: Unique frame filter flag (default = 0 (disabled)). When the flag is set, only new frames from the movie are output when the object receives a bang. If no new frame has been decompressed, the jit.movie object will not respond to the bang.

attribute.name: usedstrect
attribute.description: Destination rect flag (default = 0). When the flag is set, the dstrect attributes are used when copying an input matrix to the internal matrix.

attribute.name: usesrcrect
attribute.description: Source rect flag (default = 0). When the flag is set, the srcrect attributes are used when copying an input matrix to the internal matrix.

seealso.display: Video and Graphics 01: Display a Video
seealso.name: 01-Display a Video

seealsolist.seealso: Video and Graphics 01: Display a Video

seealso.display: Video and Graphics 09: Building Live Video Effects
seealso.name: 09-Building Live Video Effects

seealsolist.seealso: Video and Graphics 09: Building Live Video Effects

c74object.discussion:
This document refers to the viddll engine version of jit.movie.
The viddll backed jit.movie relies heavily on the cache_size attribute for performance, especially when playing in reverse.
